comments.body:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1806

All the parts are here, but not completely functional.  Been in the weeds too long, it would be good to have your input and I can make a punchlist from there.

Thanks!

[~ashamblin], thanks for asking me to also take a look at what you have so far. Here's some feedback:

# Using the Instance details page as a comparison, it looks like the font sizes for State, Alarm, and Actions don't match.
# Using the Instance details page as a comparison, it looks like the field alignments don't match. Generally, the fields should be left-aligned and along the same vertical line. The "Trigger alarm when" section is an exception because it should read like a sentence, which is what you have.
# When you reduce the width of the page, the fields in the "Trigger alarm when" section reformat in funky ways.

This is looking good. Simple and powerful!

Hi [~ashamblin], great start!

Please watch for things like using the same classes as other landing pages...things like section headers etc should be using the same classes as other pages so they have the same styling. Your actions editor should be styled the same way as the tag editor, for example. 

Also, general alignment stuff needs some work...labels aligned to fields, fields and labels aligned to each other, buttons in the right places, etc. 

In the actions section, the execute line should be hidden rather than disabled, please. 

Overall, awesome job so far. Will check more thoroughly when you're all done. Please be sure to have [~kgill] and [~dkavanagh] take a look at code as well, they will notice things like will be helpful to you. 

Thanks!

[~ashamblin]: I've completed my initial review of https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1806 and it looks great overall.  Just a few questions/comments...
- Was there a compelling reason to separate the charting API and service modules from cloudwatch_charts.js?
- The ARN parsing code seems somewhat over-engineered.  Could we simplify that a bit?
- Many elements in the templates are missing i18n:translate attributes -- are you planning on adding those?
- There are a few stray console.log statements -- are you planning on removing those?

[~kgill]
RE: console.logs and i18n tags, yes, these are to be added.

The charting services were moved to be used independently elsewhere, in alarm_detail.js where I did not need the page-specific code contained in cloudwatch_charts.js.  First iteration, separating code into services and directives loosened the coupling; this iteration makes future and potentially novel application possible.  This also sets up the cloudwatchChart directive to be decoupled from CloudwatchChartsCtrl by way of the parent controller reference.

The ARN parsing code is certainly over-engineered for a single ARN.  However, Amazon exposes over 50 services with ARNs, each with a different format.  The three classes in arn.py make up the steps to handle future ARNs:

# The metaclass provides a simple factory method for identifying the type of ARN encountered and providing the appropriate instance.  As it is provided as a metaclass to the AmazonResourceName class, any class that inherits from AmazonResourceName is automatically available to the factory method, divesting future developers from the need to provide matching code or alter the factory method.
# The ServiceNamespace decorator allows the developer to "tag" their ARN class with the appropriate ARN namespace and avoid having to provide a match method as mentioned above.  I like this approach as it allows string values to act as symbols.
# AmazonResourceName class provides the match() class method and parses the first portion of the ARN, which is consistent across all services.

I only wrote one ARN class, but this allows all future classes to a) inherit from AmazonResourceName, b) decorate with the service namespace, and c) simply write the parsing code specific to that resource.

Also, and I haven't needed to write this part yet, I want to add the ability to generate ARNs from input values.  No need here, but could be cool later.
[~ashamblin]: Ah, sounds good w.r.t. i18n/console.log and ARN comments -- carry on!
As per our conversation, I'd like to merge this PR thus far and open tickets for the remainder of the features on the page, if you find that agreeable.
[~ashamblin]: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1806 merged.  Left branch open in case remaining work will be on the GUI-2197 branch.
[~ashamblin]: Based on your comments w.r.t. the remainder of the features here please advise if this ticket is ready to move to QA.

just FYI this ticket hasn't passed UX review yet, so shouldn't go to QA.

I would like to see this code merged ASAP though so we can start working on create alarm. There is still a lot of CW work to do and not a lot of time left. Maybe this ticket needs to have scope reduced so it can be merged sooner?

Looking awesome, [~ashamblin]! A couple of small things:

* Label alignment is still a bit off. They should all the right aligned with each other. Screenshot attached to show you.
* There's a weird almost ghosted partial container appearing above the chart. Screenshot attached.
Minor layout updates, as noted.  Fixed missing chart header.

There is a new PR, as the first for this ticket was merged:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1848

Getting there, [~ashamblin]!

* We need to handle better when a resource is no longer there, which is what I suspect is happening with TheChurn that causes the waitress error? If we delete a resource that is the only one associated with an alarm, we should delete the alarm too. 
*  Breadcrumb says "CloudWatchAlarms", should just say Alarms (this needs fixing on the landing page as well, I just noticed it)
* Save Changes button should be disabled until something on the page is actually changed (see Instance detail page for model)


Those look like the last few things...looking great!

[~jloza]

Waitress error is caused by missing labels for metric types.  We need to provide user-friendly labels for all of the below metric types.
Will update breadcrumb.
Form validation, which includes Save Changes disabling is handled in ticket GUI-2457.

Could use help providing user-friendly labels for the following metrics:

CPUUtilization
DiskReadBytes
DiskReadOps
DiskWriteBytes
DiskWriteOps
NetworkIn
NetworkOut
StatusCheckFailed
StatusCheckFailed_Instance
StatusCheckFailed_System
VolumeConsumedReadWriteOps
VolumeIdleTime
VolumeQueueLength
VolumeReadBytes
VolumeReadOps
VolumeThroughputPercentage
VolumeTotalReadTime
VolumeTotalWriteTime
VolumeWriteBytes
VolumeWriteOps

hi [~ashamblin], you'll see user-friendly labels for each of those in the create alarm wireframe, hope this helps!

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+alarm

YAY! UX review passed, ready for code review. 

Great job, [~ashamblin]!
looks good. merged
Pulling out of QA to address issue with using listMetrics to populate dimensions (see comments in GUI-2199)

[~jloza]: There's another issue on the alarm details page w.r.t. modifying dimensions.  When you select multiple instances, only one is saved (see screenshot 'alarm-details-multiple-instances-issue.png' of what's seen before the alarm is saved).  We handled this better in old Create Alarm dialog by separating the resource type selector form the resources chosen widget, easily allowing multiple instances to be selected for the alarm.  

So perhaps what's needed here is a simple way to select the resource type or dimension key (e.g. InstanceID, ImageID, InstanceType, AvailabilityZone) *separately* from the resources themselves (one more more Instance IDs if key='InstanceId'.  The old create alarm dialog handled this fairly well (try it in the 4.2 console on the Create Scaling Policy page), and we should offer something similar in the 4.3 console IMO.
See EUCA-12185
[~dkavanagh]: See my latest comment in EUCA-12185
Sounds like based on the EUCA ticket that the dimension selector should be changed to single chosen (still search-enabled) from multi-chosen.

Alarm Details page ready for another UX review.  Use the GUI-2539 branch

PR is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1900

The detail page doesn't show data for the resource in the dimension. I've attached the cloudwatch API request for the metrics page (which does properly graph the data) and below, for the alarms detail page (which shows "no data available")

It looks to me like "duration", "period" probably need to be added. I also notice the statistic and unit are different.
UX review passed, GUI-2546 opened to change alarm name when dimension is changed. Ready for code review.
[~dkavanagh] Chart issue on Alarm Details page fixed in commit https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/fe0c75a86916222a (part of PR 1900)
[~jloza], no confirmation on delete action?

I've attached a graph of the same metric from metrics landing, then from the alarm detail page for that same metric/resource. All the data points are zero + the scale is 0-100, so that's different and the legend doesn't indicate the instance name.

Chart y-range issue fixed in commit https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/ea8d1be43c4bb52681004d8811a

Missing resource name in chart label fixed in commit 
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/abf8095baf8fc15
Opened GUI-2548 to track missing delete confirmation dialog
not bad, but it graph legend is only set properly on initial page load. Try selecting another dimension. I see the $watch function, but something is going wrong there.
[~dkavanagh]: ok, I think I've got the label handling sorted out now.  Added a bit of code to handle the 'All instances' label for EC2 metrics.
There's also an "All ELBs". That may be in GUI-2411 though. I'll check your PR to see how that affects things.

[~dkavanagh]: I've pinged Evan in GUI-2411 to determine if Eucalyptus supports the "All ELBs" dimension for alarms.  I suspect we do support that, and it should be fairly trivial to add that to the dimension choices.
Added "All load balancers" choice in commit https://git.io/vwlHj
[~dkavanagh], Delete alarm definitely should bring up the delete alarm dialog. HOLY SHIT IT DOESN'T!!! Sigh. I'll file a bug.
[~jloza]: We have GUI-2548 open to track the missing delete confirmation dialog, already linked to this ticket.
alarm delete modal doesn't conform to wireframe.
We have GUI-2548 to track the delete confirmation dialog
I wish you had done GUI-2548 work in a separate branch because I was hoping to merge PR#1900.
[~dkavanagh]: That shouldn't prevent us from merging PR 1900.  We can always open a new GUI-2548 branch to address updates needed for the delete confirmation dialog, right?

Discovered an issue w.r.t. alarm actions when updating an alarm on the alarm details page -- tracked in GUI-2559.

[~alice], [~ccassler]: Please hold on QA'ing this ticket until GUI-2559 is merged to master.
